intro: Rauvolfia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian rosy periwinkle, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
